revised_title: Extension of the Electron Pairing Theory to Conjugated Hydrocarbons
tldr: The authors extend the electron pairing theory to conjugated hydrocarbons, deriving formulas for calculating internuclear distances, force constants, and interaction constants. They introduce mutual bond polarizabilities and demonstrate their relationship to similar quantities in molecular orbital theory. The study provides a more accurate method for understanding the structure and behavior of conjugated hydrocarbons.
